title: Free Family Portrait Studio
description: With former CEO David Wallace's help, Andy launches a plan to get revenge on the Scranton branch. Meanwhile, Dwight launches his own plan to find out if he's the father of Angela's baby.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [to webcam] Hello. My name's Oscar. I'm an accountant in Scranton, Pennsylvania and I'm gay. And I'm here to tell you that yes- it does get better. When I was younger, um-

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: What's he doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He's searching out younger gays.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: No, it's just a way to tell young people, no matter how hard it gets for them, there's a brighter future ahead.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: ...with you. [chuckles]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: No matter how hard it gets for you, eh- Kelly, seriously, I-

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Just keep chatting. I'm just checking my makeup in your webcam.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Do you not own a mirror?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Webcams make me look the way I do in my fantasies.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know, right? What is it? You always look so good in those things.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I'm throwing out all my mirrors.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Okay, as you can see, I now have a cool job at a dynamic workplace. Being gay is a celebration of life, it's a simple-

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: No, I'm sorry, I just can't sit idly by and have the gay youth of America misled by some reductionist-

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It's not misleading.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: -pep talk. Sexuality is a spectrum. It's a paradox to think of any sexual activity as "normal." It gets better but it also gets vastly more complicated.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hey, Robert, that guy, he looks just like you. [Robert backs into Kevin's nose] Ooh! [whimpers]

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Ow! Damn it, Kevin! God!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You okay, Robert?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Fine.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Put some ice on it.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: In any case, it gets better. [Kevin cries] Maybe- maybe not much better... but better.

quotes.speaker: Sasha
quotes.text: One, two, three!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I wanted to give a nice gift to the tenants in the building. At first I thought, "muffin basket." Then I thought, "What's even more precious to people than muffins?"

quotes.speaker: Jake
quotes.text: Can you just smile, please?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I don't want to!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: ...their own children.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey everybody, just a few hours left for the free family portrait studio. Darryl. We'd love to see little Jada come by. Angela? Why don't you bring by your little angel?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim, you've got those two cute kids. We sure would love to see them.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I know why you're doing this, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Last week, I may have gone too far. I'll explain it quickly. Basically, I found out where he gets his clothes dry-cleaned. Custom ordered the same suit, made with tear-away Velcro. And... you can fill in the rest.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Jim rips off his clothes] Wha-? [Stanley laughs] Damn it, Jim!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Now he's trying to get me to bring my children in to work. I think it's fair to be cautious.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Let me get this straight. You lost all of it. All your winnings. A hundred and fifty thousand dollars.

quotes.speaker: Hide
quotes.text: Bad economy. Bad investment.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You mean to tell me no one wanted an energy drink for Asian homosexuals?

quotes.speaker: Calvin
quotes.text: They did not.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: And you got half a million of these? Well I gotta try it.

quotes.speaker: Calvin
quotes.text: I wouldn't.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Aw, come on. What's the harm? [makes face] Mmm. What flavor was that?

quotes.speaker: Hide
quotes.text: Coconut penis.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: The coconut's pretty subtle.

quotes.speaker: Calvin
quotes.text: Come on, man. Can't you just give us a yes or a no?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I don't know, man. Y'all quit with a lot of confidence. I mean, it was like, y'all came up in here dancing and everybody was- [sees Val] ooh, hold on a second. [sees Brandon] Oh.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: If I were Val, I would break up with Brandon. Then I would date the hell out of me. I wouldn't give in to me too fast, let me buy myself some nice dinners and such. But when I finally did give in, I would go crazy on myself.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [wearing janitor outfit] Hi guys.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: How's it going, man?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [whimpering] I'm- I'm good, thank you. And how are you?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Great, yeah, good.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Oh, how the mediocre have fallen.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh God.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Look, I'm not here to get my old job back. I had my opportunity, I blew it, I'm moving on. I just wanted to come in here and literally beg you for something, anything. I will sweep the floors, water the plants...

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: No, you don't understand-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Clean the toilets.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: I don't need anyone to-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Pull the poop out of the toilets.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: That's not even a thing.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Just, please...

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Please!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Give me something!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Why don't you clean the carpets for today?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: You're welcome. Up you get then. Pick yourself up. There it is.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: You don't need to-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I have a delicious secret.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Good, good. This carpet's overdue for a good mopping.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Is a mop the most efficient tool to use on a carpet?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, it is actually.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Mmm, I can't hold it in any longer. Um, I am faking this, okay? Because I convinced David Wallace to buy Dunder Mifflin back from Sabre. And at three o'clock today he's gonna walk in here and reinstate me as manager.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [enters with the kids] Family picture!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam? No!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What? Honey, we talked about this.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, we talked about not bringing them in to Dwight's photo studio slash trap.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes, and then we decided that was crazy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, we decided it was crazy not to worry about it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, we settled in a much more rational place, remember?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We decided that there's no way Dwight would harm a child.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But are you a hundred percent sure? I don't think any of us are.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, no.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: But it's free. And we'll keep our eye on them.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And we'll make sure Dwight doesn't do anything C-R-A-Z-Y.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Wait, C-R-A-Z...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Great, right up there.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. You just sit right here. Here we go.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright. Why don't you just-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, great. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: -give him to me and... perfect.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: This is great.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You ready?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Excuse me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: There we go.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Just do it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'll just stand here?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, just keep your eye on Dwight, great.

quotes.speaker: Photographer
quotes.text: Sir, could you look into the camera?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Let's do it, shoot it.

quotes.speaker: Photographer
quotes.text: Sir.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Up here. [whistles]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. Yeah, yeah, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim, right here, right here. [snaps fingers] Okay, good.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, so that's it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: See? That wasn't so hard.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Cute kids, thanks for coming.

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.text: Hello, Erin. Hello, everybody.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Uh, what? Why? Uh, hi honey. What- how are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.text: Hi, you know, my office got a call that they were shooting family portraits right here. And if there's one thing that every politician instinctively understands, it's a good photo op.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [laughs] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Heh.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Okay, you're going to go through the hallway. Here's a map. And if you get lost, just follow the blue line. [points to line on floor]

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, well, well. Senator Lipton, welcome. Angela.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Nice to see you. May I hold him?

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No. I am going to hold him because I haven't seen him all day.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I think that Dwight is doing this whole thing to, um, get a sample of my baby's DNA to prove he's the father. Which... is impossible... because the senator is the only man I've ever been with.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [Phillip cries] See the duckie!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, hold on for a second, folks. A few of the baby's hairs are out of place.

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.text: Oh, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [slaps Dwight's hand away] No. No. I like the baby's hair the way it is.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: This is getting more and more delicious by the minute. [gargles alcohol, chokes, coughs] It's go time.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey Nellie, I made soup - I made you some soup.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Well, I don't want any soup.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: But it's really good- [drops soup] Oh!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh come on, Andy!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I know this is going to be a great payoff.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: A delicious moment.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: But after you're manager, some of these images are going to be hard to shake.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, but it-

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Just calibrate. Okay? Calibrate.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, here we go. Oh, you know what? I don't want to throw a wrench in the works, but I want everything to be perfect and the baby's fingernails are just bothering me-

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Uh-uh, leave us alone.

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.text: I guess we're okay with the fingernails.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, great. Suit yourself. Although, are those excess skin cells on the baby's cheek distracting to you as well?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Dwight, we're fine!

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.text: Oopsie, did somebody make a boopsie?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh no. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.text: I'm just gonna take him out and change him just for a second.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He defecated, aw.

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.text: You're stinky.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: A lot has changed since y'all left, okay? You're gonna have to jump through some hoops. And the new foreman is here. Now she's one of the best we've ever known, okay? So I need you to show her your upmost respect. Make sure she feels welcome and at home, okay? Can you do that?

quotes.speaker: Brandon
quotes.text: That's some pretty blatant complementing you're doing there, man. I don't even talk to her like that.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: Uh, Brandon?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I would.

quotes.speaker: Brandon
quotes.text: You would?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Brandon
quotes.text: Sounds like you're trying to hit on my girlfriend.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: Calm down, he's not.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yes, I am. Just so everyone's on the same page.

quotes.speaker: Brandon
quotes.text: [scoffs] So you really think she's gonna leave a guy who owns his own restaurant for a dude who ate his own restaurant?

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: Brandon!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Good slam.

quotes.speaker: Brandon
quotes.text: Thank you, Biggie.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Good luck to you.

quotes.speaker: Brandon
quotes.text: Oh, and have a burger for me.

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.text: Okay, shall we take a few more?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I think we have all the shots we need. Thank you, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.text: Okay. There we go.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No! Dwight! Give me the diaper! Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Is this what you were looking for? Huh? Huh?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Andy, we wanted to talk to you. A lot of us are very concerned about you.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: You're dirty, you stink of booze, you're limping inexplicably.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I just want you guys not to worry. 'Cause old Andy's gonna be just fine.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, no, see? This is what we're talking about. I mean, what was that accent? And last time I checked, you were drunk and now you're not drunk...

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: No, unfortunately it's true. He's been a nightmare. And the worst part is, he's been taking it out on me.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You hit her?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No. That is not the deal. Calibrate.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: He's not hitting me. But, he's been verbally abusing me-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That's not true either! That's also total- Everyone, please relax. I think you're gonna like this surprise guest.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: [enters] Happy birthday to Gabe!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh, get out, skeleton man!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I can refer you to someone to talk to.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [his phone rings] Huh? Hold on.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Give you a name or-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I just gonna- quick- [answers phone] Hello? Hey, what's the scoop? Are you close? What? No. no, no, no, no, no. You have to come now. Traffic clears? No, next Friday... that's not gonna work. Okay. Yeah. Okay. [inhales, hangs up] Damn it! Well, this is not going to be quite as delicious as I wanted, but I do have a very tasty announcement for you guys. Not only am I not a lowly janitor, I am the regional manager once again! Guys, I got my old job back!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh boy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm not crazy. I convinced David Wallace to give me my job back.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: David Wallace hasn't worked here in years.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Okay, yes, I see the confusion. I saw David at the fundraiser. He is now a multi-millionaire because he sold his toy vacuum "Suck It" to the U.S. military.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Andy, come on.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Even I know that's weird.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I- I- Okay, I get how that sounds crazy.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hey, Andy, Nobody's calling you crazy, Andy. We're your friends, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Stop saying my name.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: No, he's not making this up.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thank you, Erin.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Andy tells me about seeing David Wallace all the time.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: But have you ever actually seen him yourself?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh my God.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Erin, come- Come on. You know I've been talking to David Wallace.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Do you see David Wallace in the room right now?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [into phone] Operation Phoenix is a go. Just get the car ready.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Now you look at me like you're adoring me, I'm gonna look at the camera like I don't even know you're there.

quotes.speaker: Ravi
quotes.text: I do adore you.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Andrew, it's time for you to go home. You're better than this.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, I know.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Everyone's better than this, because this is the worst thing I have ever seen. [drinks coconut penis energy drink] Why'd they add coconut? I miss original.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Others
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Hey guys, long time.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: David, what are you doing here?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Is it true you're buying the company?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Okay, I guess the word is out. Uh, please keep this a secret, but yes, I've been talking with Andy-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What? Thought I heard my name. What? I'm the new manager?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: I'll get to that in a second, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: But it's- it is- it is me? Right?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Yes, as we've discussed-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: But it's very possible-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh my God!

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Probable.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Wow. From janitor to manager?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That's quite a Cinderella story. From M-O-P to M-V-P.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: There's an official announcement, a few details to be-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: From total loss to total boss, I mean-

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Can we expect any payroll interruptions?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Now that is a great question, Stanley. Right now I think all your operations or most of your operations are pretty much down in Florida, so to shift back up-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I was so looking forward to that and it did not... go as I thought it would.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: So we're not gonna be a part of Sabre anymore?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Actually, nothing is gonna be a part of Sabre anymore. Jo Bennett's planning on liquidating the rest of the company.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Oof. [laughs] Wouldn't wanna be a Sabre employee right about now. [laughs] I'm actually the CEO.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Ah, I didn't realize you were standing there.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Hey, my friend, trust me. This is for the best. I never understood that corporate mess.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Well, okay. Great to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Likewise, I'm Bob. Bob Kazamakis.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Pleasure.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: I'd love to give you a little rundown on what I've learned about this place.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: That's very gracious of you, Bob. I would love that.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Please. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Guess I'd better take off these dirty rags. Figure out how to be a manager of this place.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Perhaps your year of experience managing this branch will come in handy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Gosh, I hope so.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No! God, Mose! God!

quotes.speaker: Mose
quotes.text: Hi, Angela.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Get out of the car! Get out! Where is he?

quotes.speaker: Mose
quotes.text: I'm not supposed to say.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes! [slaps Mose] Tell me! Tell me where he is! Mose, damn it! Where did he go? Mose! Get back here!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [taking photo with Jada] Let's see that smile. Go on. [waves to Val]

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: [stands next to him] Right here?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Cool.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Looks like I might get my delicious moment after all.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: May I say one thing?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It would be rude of me not to let you say whatever's on your mind.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: The quality of mercy is not strained.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: It droppeth as the gentle rain from heaven upon the place beneath.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Do not bring Shakespeare into this. How dare you play the bard card?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: It blesseth he who gives and he who takes. 'Tis mightiest in the mightiest.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I just want one mother[bleep] delicious moment. Is that too much to ask?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: If I were to hire you back. If. What do you think you would do well?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Special projects manager, that's my background. I just go around doing whatever I want.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: All right, you sly bastard. When can you start?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Okay everyone. I had a conversation with Bob, and since I am going to be CEO now there'll be no need for him.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Ouch. That's gotta hurt!

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: But, he is going to be making so much money from the liquidation, he's gonna be freed up to do something much more important.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: David has generously offered to donate one million dollars in matching funds to a cause that's very dear to me. So, for the next three years, I'll be travelling overseas, concentrating all of my efforts on educating- mentoring, some African, some Asian, but mainly Eastern European women.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: I had no idea how pervasive this problem was until Bob explained it to me.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Oprah Winfrey's leadership academy and other schools like it, while wonderful, end with high school. I want to see these girls right through college, especially the gymnasts. They've lost so many years of crucial education to perfecting their bodies. Muscle groups the rest of us can't even fathom.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Gymnasts? You're going to seek out uneducated gymnasts?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Yeah, so I'm hoping to identify some truly exceptional women who show great promise. Well, Andy, it's been fun.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Mm. Mm-hmm. [they hug, Robert kisses him on the lips]

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: It's been a great year.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Where is it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: They're testing it now.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: How long does it take to get the results?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Seventy-two hours.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You're gonna wait here?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes. [Angela sits and holds his hand]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [Dwight kisses her] Dwight, I can't do this. Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Senator Lipton. Hey, how are you?

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.text: You didn't call.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Um, well, uh, the issue that I- that concerned me...

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.text: You know what this is about. [covers Phillip's eyes] Call.
